name: PATHABLE
documentation: The `PATHABLE` class defines the pathing capabilities used by nearly all classes in the openEHR reference model, mostly via inheritance of `LOCATABLE`. The defining characteristics of `PATHABLE` objects are that they can locate child objects using paths, and they know their parent object in a compositional hierarchy. The parent feature is defined as abstract in the model, and may be implemented in any way convenient.

parent.name: parent
parent.documentation: Parent of this node in a compositional hierarchy.

item_at_path.name: item_at_path
item_at_path.documentation: The item at a path (relative to this item); only valid for unique paths, i.e. paths that resolve to a single item.

items_at_path.name: items_at_path
items_at_path.documentation: List of items corresponding to a non-unique path.

path_exists.name: path_exists
path_exists.documentation: True if the path exists in the data with respect to the current item.

path_unique.name: path_unique
path_unique.documentation: True if the path corresponds to a single item in the data.

path_of_item.name: path_of_item
path_of_item.documentation: The path to an item relative to the root of this archetyped structure.
